author: gregoryw
title: Sanitation Microfarming (tm) PBC
description: In Ethiopia few people have access to clean sanitation and water. At the same time Ethiopia and the rest of Africa need blockchain tech.

assessments.note: This project perfectly adresses the challenge to grow Cardano in Africa, as it brings double benefits: Benefiting local community, fixing some of their serious problems, bringing wealth and adding a new blockchain to the cardano ecosystem.

This is a very comprehensive and detailed proposal that features an idea that could benefit many people in rural Africa. It is really refreshing to see a green project in the blockchain space which is known for wasting so much energy. Converting waste into useable soil will definitely happen and I hope Cardano is a part of it.
This is an interesting idea. It doesn't really drive Cardano in Africa, as the Cardano side would be the people donating.

This proposal is the full package. From solid waste to solid value. The complex mix of accounting operations involved requires a lot of trust in order to ensure that everyone involved is a good actor and block chain will address this concern.

The proposal is bold but provides and use case of Cardano as a add on. However there are very  strong reason for funding the biggest being the effect on climate. Cardano is planning to have a substantial presence in Ethiopia and this project can be a valuable add on.

The idea of sanitation microfarming has a lot of value, and the integration with Cardano seems like an interesting use case. However there are many unknowns about the project, and the scale on the non-blockchain aspects are so large, that I worry the project will stall before the blockchain is implemented and has the intended effect on Cardano adoption in Africa.

As a process engineer who already knows the excellent feasibility and flexibility of black soldier flies for similar purposes, I am amazed of the concept and think indeed it is technologically feasible. Storing information on the revenue on a blockchain should not be a problem either. I very much hope this project is funded, as it will provide a lot of great benefits.

The team behind this proposal has a wide range of impressive experience listed and they do a great job of mapping out the steps. Having a famous film maker like Bill Duke promoting this project increases the chances of success. The timeline is clear and seems realistic on the manual labor and logistics, but is more vague on the technical (Khepera coin, smart contracts, and NFT system). Great idea, great team, and clear roadmap to success!
A reasonable part of this idea relies on the physical sanitation units. Is this tech actually up and running and approved for use? What would be the cost per D-lav for someone to donate?

The team has clearly spent many hours working on this project. The scope of work, plan, and timeline all have been identified. The risky bits are with the block chain implementation and how to provide authentic data into the block chain but this will be addressed with the funding and hiring IOHK. beyond that, there is always some risk involved with complex systems like these.

One of the most documented proposals in this challenge. The people behind it are experienced and driven to make the project happen. The attachments offer great insight into their ideas and demonstrate the needs and benefits, while also adding value to the Cardano blockchain.

The proposer claims indepth experiance in the field and the team has diversified members. The revenue generation for sustainable and commitment to return the investment are unique. The project has only the risk of technical challenges on the bio side. If we accept the claim that the prototype is already a success there is very good chance the project will succeeded.

Several interesting people with relevant backgound are involved in the project but in general the blockchain aspect of the proposal seems like an afterthought.  The plan calls for large investment in infrastructure, mass production of sanipods, construction of an experimental compound, and large numbers of staff when the the sanipod technology has not undergone any small scale pilot testing in the target environment. 

I think some small scale proof of concept would be required, and a stronger argument for the blockchain integration be made, before the proposal seems feasible and appropriate for catalyst.

The project is explained really well and according to the presentation I cannot see any problems in it's feasibility, providing that the schedule can be kept, but even if it can't thisshould not be detrimental to the project itself. It adresses the presented challenge and multiple other challenges very well.

The blockchain aspects of this proposal are still a little vague. It is mentioned that with the 150k initial funding after 12 months of operation they will return 300k profit back into the fund. Why not just get started if this business is going to be so profitable? It's not hard to find people who want to double their money. The proposal mentions "creation of blockchain assets: Khepera coin, smart contracts, product proof NFT system and integration with payment services to receive and fiat and turn local currency into crypto currency" and doesn't do enough to breakdown the technical aspects. I think waiting for those details will make this proposal more realistic in Fund 6 or Fund 7 or once Alonzo is deployed and smart contracts are live. This is going to be huge for rural Africa and I hope Cardano does not miss out, but it seems waiting for details on smart contracts is necessary.

It is not clear how this project grows Cardano in Africa given the Afrcian side is about the D-Lavs. It is also not clear if the D-Lav is proven tech and if there are any approvals required for usage.
The team provides clear goals, milestones, and plan. There won't be any issue auditing this one.
The proposal is very well documented, offering vast explanations about all the details, making it easy to assess it over time.
The project has a clear plan and stages which will produce measurable data to identify progress. The white paper outlining the proposal is sufficient to assess that that the proposal is audit able.

The proposal includes the construction of experimental buildings which will be error prone and difficult to audit. The cost of the buildings, and sanipods, and blockchain development in the proposal seems arbitrary.  Much of the funds are allotted to be spent before any pilot program would take place. Tracking the use of funds and the efficiency with which they are applied would be extremely difficult.

solution: Khepera SCA has developed a new industry to solve both problems - Sanitation Microfarming(tm) PBC (Proved By Cryptography)
experience: We are inventors (including a NASA scientist) crypto enthusiasts, business people and artists dedicated to blockchain utility and positivity
